docs.snippet: Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos on Wednesday warned leftist rebels that their illicit fortune would be seized and used to pay reparations to war victims should voters approve a peace agreement in an Oct. 2 plebiscite....
docs.lead_paragraph: Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos on Wednesday warned leftist rebels that their illicit fortune would be seized and used to pay reparations to war victims should voters approve a peace agreement in an Oct. 2 plebiscite.

headline.main: Colombia's Santos Warns FARC: We'll Come After Your Money

docs.snippet: Keith Scott, the black man fatally shot by a black police officer in Charlotte, North Carolina, on Tuesday, was remembered by family members and neighbors as a "likeable" person as the city braced for possibly more rioting triggered by his killing...

docs.snippet: Since a bomb exploded in Chelsea, the police have responded to more than 800 reports of suspicious packages in New York City, far more than usual....
docs.lead_paragraph: Since a bomb exploded in Chelsea, the police have responded to more than 800 reports of suspicious packages in New York City, far more than usual.
docs.abstract: New York City police have responded to over 800 calls reporting suspicious packages around city since explosion in Chelsea neighborhood; police spokesman says sharp increase in calls is normal after such attacks.

headline.main: If You See Something, Say Something — and New Yorkers Have, in Droves
headline.print_headline: Calls to Police on Packages Rise Sharply After Bomb
